artesanias.name: Traditional Wool Tapestry
artesanias.description: Beautiful tapestry woven on a backstrap loom with local sheep wool dyed with natural pigments from regional plants.
artesanias.story: This technique was taught by my grandmother when I was 8 years old. Each symbol in the tapestry represents elements of our nature and ancestral beliefs. The colors are obtained from flowers that grow on the sacred hill.

artesanias.name: Natural Silk Rebozo
artesanias.description: Fine rebozo woven on pedal loom with natural silk and traditional embroidery that tells community stories.
artesanias.story: The rebozo is more than a garment, it's the history of our women. Each pattern has a special meaning passed from mother to daughter. The designs represent the river, the mountains and the cycle of life.

artesanias.name: Ceremonial Wool Sash
artesanias.description: Traditional sash used in important ceremonies, woven with symbols representing the local worldview.
artesanias.story: Each sash tells the story of who wears it. The symbols represent achievements, dreams and protections. My great-grandmother taught me that weaving is a conversation with ancestors, every stitch is a word.

artesanias.name: Hand Embroidered Tablecloth
artesanias.description: Ceremonial tablecloth entirely hand-embroidered with floral motifs and regional animals, ideal for festivities.
artesanias.story: This tablecloth represents the weddings of our community. Each embroidered flower symbolizes a wish of happiness for the couple. I learned the techniques from the wise women of the town when I was a child.

artesanias.name: Black Clay Vessel
artesanias.description: Ceremonial vessel made with ancestral black clay technique, hand-polished, unique in the region.
artesanias.story: The black clay from our region is unique in the world. We collect it during the rainy season and each piece carries the essence of our land. Polishing with stone gives it that characteristic shine.

artesanias.name: Fresh Water Jug
artesanias.description: Traditional jug for fresh water with built-in natural filter and ergonomic design that maintains temperature.
artesanias.story: Our family has made these jugs for over 80 years. The design keeps water naturally cool thanks to the thickness of the clay. Each jug is personally tested before sale.

artesanias.name: Traditional Clay Comal
artesanias.description: Circular comal for tortillas made with special clay that distributes heat evenly, essential in local kitchens.
artesanias.story: The perfect comal should cook tortillas without burning them. This wisdom comes from my ancestors who discovered the exact clay mixture to achieve the ideal cooking point.

artesanias.name: Tree of Life
artesanias.description: Polychrome clay sculpture representing the tree of life, with figures narrating the creation of the world.
artesanias.story: Each tree of life tells a different story. Mine represents the legend of how our town was founded by the gods of corn and rain. It's my way of preserving our beliefs.

artesanias.name: Ritual Carved Mask
artesanias.description: Ceremonial mask carved in copal wood with representations of ancestral deities and guardian spirits.
artesanias.story: Each mask tells a story of our ancestors. The symbols represent the connection between the earthly and spiritual worlds. I only use woods that fall naturally, I never cut living trees.

artesanias.name: Traditional Wooden Toy
artesanias.description: Educational toys carved from local woods with natural finish safe for children, teaching about local culture.
artesanias.story: I create toys that last generations, like the ones my grandfather made for me. Each piece teaches about our culture and values. Children learn playing about the animals and plants of our region.

artesanias.name: Story-Carved Chest
artesanias.description: Wooden chest carved with scenes of daily life and founding myths of the town, perfect for keeping family treasures.
artesanias.story: Each chest is like an open book. This one tells the story of how monarch butterflies guided our ancestors to these lands. The carving techniques I learned from the old masters of the town.

artesanias.name: Ancestral Musical Instrument
artesanias.description: Traditional flute carved from a single piece of wood, tuned according to ancestral musical scales of the region.
artesanias.story: Each flute has its own voice. I choose the wood according to the moon and season of the year. The sound it produces should imitate the forest birds and the wind in the mountains, as my grandfather taught me.
